p: The risk of cancer is directly associated with both intrinsic and non-intrinsic factors. Intrinsic factors are inherent to human cell biology and, therefore, non-modifiable, such as spontaneous modifications in DNA that can contribute to the cancer initiation process. Non-intrinsic elements are entirely modifiable and comprehend endogenous and exogenous aspects of cultural habits acquired by society, such as unhealthy lifestyles, exposure to carcinogenic/mutagenic chemicals, and the generation and accumulation of free radicals throughout life [ 31].
